commitMessage:
fix: fix test isolation leak in local-pm-adapter-unified smoke tests (HODGE-304)

## What Changed
- Modified src/lib/pm/local-pm-adapter-unified.smoke.test.ts (38 lines changed)
  - Wrapped 3 smoke tests with withTestWorkspace for proper isolation
  - Test 1: "should extend BasePMAdapter" (lines 14-19)
  - Test 2: "should implement all abstract methods" (lines 21-32)
  - Test 3: "should fetch Hodge workflow states" (lines 71-81)
  
- Auto-updated .hodge metadata files (session, context, mappings)
  - Created HODGE-304 feature tracking

## Why This Change
The GitHub Actions "Quality Checks" workflow was failing because three smoke tests 
were creating LocalPMAdapter instances without a basePath parameter. When basePath 
is undefined, the adapter defaults to "." (current directory), causing tests to 
create .hodge/project_management.md in the real project directory instead of 
isolated temp directories.

The test isolation integration test detected this leak using a marker file check:
  Expected: No files created in project .hodge during tests
  Actual: project_management.md was created

Root cause: LocalPMAdapter constructor defaults basePath to "." when not specified.
Solution: Wrap all three tests with withTestWorkspace helper (same pattern used 
in 9 other tests in the same file).
